data.name: Helm 3.7.0
data.body:
Helm v3.7.0 is a feature release. Users are encouraged to upgrade for the best experience.

The community keeps growing, and we'd love to see you there!

- Join the discussion in [Kubernetes Slack](https://kubernetes.slack.com):
  -  for questions and just to hang out
  -  for discussing PRs, code, and bugs
- Hang out at the Public Developer Call: Thursday, 9:30 Pacific via [Zoom](https://zoom.us/j/696660622)
- Test, debug, and contribute charts: [ArtifactHub/packages](https://artifacthub.io/packages/search?kind=0)

## Notable Changes

A few major changes were made to the experimental OCI feature:

- `helm chart export` has been removed
- `helm chart list` has been removed
- `helm chart pull` has been replaced with `helm pull`
- `helm chart push` has been replaced with `helm push`
- `helm chart remove` has been removed
- `helm chart save` has been replaced with `helm package`

In addition, a change to the experimental OCI manifest format was introduced, preventing Helm 3.7 from fetching charts built
with older versions of the experimental OCI feature. Users will need to re-package and upload their OCI charts when upgrading to Helm 3.7.  This change does not affect standard Helm charts.

Many of the details of these changes can be found in [HIP 6](https://github.com/helm/community/blob/main/hips/hip-0006.md).

Other notable changes:

- introduced `helm uninstall --wait`
- introduced `helm show crds`
- introduced `--max-col-width` to `helm dependency list`
- introduced `--password-stdin` to `helm repo add`
- `helm install` and `helm upgrade` now respond to SIGTERM events
- `helm repo update` now accepts an optional repository name
- introduced `{{ .Chart.IsRoot }}` to the template engine
- updated to Cobra's Bash Completion v2
- updated to Kubernetes 1.22 client packages
- updated to Go 1.16

## Installation and Upgrading

Download Helm v3.7.0. The common platform binaries are here:

- [MacOS amd64](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-darwin-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum) / 0bf671be69563a0c2b4253c393bed271fab90a4aa9321d09685a781f583b5c9d)
- [MacOS arm64](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-darwin-arm64.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-darwin-arm64.tar.gz.sha256sum) / 6968d3488cf36cae00b33c3b5799a9cfa0211270ce6f90d61a5ced5eeb54c635)
- [Linux amd64](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum) / 096e30f54c3ccdabe30a8093f8e128dba76bb67af697b85db6ed0453a2701bf9)
- [Linux arm](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-arm.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-arm.tar.gz.sha256sum) / c9609757e56fa11036da469c0b7f21b6e21f05618bc437451050a8507441fe1b)
- [Linux arm64](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-arm64.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-arm64.tar.gz.sha256sum) / 03bf55435b4ebef739f862334bdfbf7b7eed714b94340a22298c485b6626aaca)
- [Linux i386](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-386.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-386.tar.gz.sha256sum) / daeb6979e1a8d32c5adaf0ce0ea6b4fede200ebe483bdd109b3b1294a6f33c2e)
- [Linux ppc64le](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-ppc64le.tar.gz) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-linux-ppc64le.tar.gz.sha256sum) / 0f997b9228a64477fc83ea515831c281074f2e01d3d0bf2c72c6163fca70d053)

- [Windows amd64](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-windows-amd64.zip) ([checksum](https://get.helm.sh/helm-v3.7.0-windows-amd64.zip.sha256sum) / cf6dd076898e2dc1e7f4af593d011f99a9de353b6a2d019731dbc254a1ec880e)

This release was signed with `967F 8AC5 E221 6F9F 4FD2 70AD 92AA 783C BAAE 8E3B` and can be found at @bacongobbler's [keybase account](https://keybase.io/bacongobbler). Please use the attached signatures for verifying this release using `gpg`.

The [Quickstart Guide](https://helm.sh/docs/intro/quickstart/) will get you going from there. For **upgrade instructions** or detailed installation notes, check the [install guide](https://helm.sh/docs/intro/install/). You can also use a [script to install](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helm/helm/main/scripts/get-helm-3) on any system with `bash`.

## What's Next

- 3.7.1 will contain only bug fixes.
- 3.8.0 is the next feature release.

data.name: v1.2.0
data.body:
## Changelog

## Features

- **M3Query**: Support Prometheus matchers with match[] URL parameters in label endpoints ([#3180](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3180))
- **M3Query**: Support Prometheus start and end time URL parameters for label and series metadata endpoints ([#3214](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3214))
- **M3Query**: Add Graphite functions and update functions with new arguments that were missing ([#3048](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3048), [#3367](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3367), [#3370](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3370), [#3145](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3145), [#3149](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3149), [#3142](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3142), [#3469](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3469), [#3484](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3484), [#3545](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3545), [#3576](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3576), [#3582](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3582), [#3583](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3583), [#3521](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3521), [#3602](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3602), [#3641](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3641), [#3644](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3644), [#3648](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3648))
- **M3Query**: Fix Graphite treatment of `**` to allow to match an empty segment instead of one or more ([#3366](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3366), [#3593](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3593))
- **M3Query**: Add M3-Limit-Max-Range header to optionally truncate time range of queries ([#3538](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3538))
- **M3Coordinator**: Add ability to use an exclude by rollup rule to rollup metrics without specific dimensions ([#3318](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3318))
- **M3DB**: Use better heuristics to cap the series and aggregate query limits that individual DB nodes apply for a query so in larger clusters the query can be clamped earlier ([#3516](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3516), [#3518](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3518), [#3519](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3519), [#3520](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3520), [#3527](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3527))
- **M3DB**: Add repair option full_sweep and ability to force a repair via API call ([#3573](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3573), [#3550](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3550))

## Bug Fixes

- **M3DB**: Fix aggregate series metadata query limits ([#3112](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3112))
- **M3Coordinator**: Make bad aggregated namespace headers return bad request status code instead of internal server error ([#3070](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3070))
- **M3Coordinator**: Propagate Require-Exhaustive parameter for aggregate series metadata queries ([#3115](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3115))
- **M3Query**: Add determinism to Graphite sort and reduce functions ([#3164](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3164))

## Performance

- **M3DB**: Rearchitect index segments to compact and expire series on block rotation instead of build a new segment for new block ([#3464](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3464))
- **M3DB**: Add postings list cache for searches and repopulate during active block index segment compaction before segment made visible for queries ([#3671](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3671))
- **M3DB**: Avoid allocating index entry fields per series and read from backing mmap directly ([#3050](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3050), [#3062](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3062), [#3057](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3057))
- **M3DB**: Avoid allocating series IDs when read from disk ([#3093](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3093))
- **M3DB**: Improve speed of tag byte reuse from ID for tags by speeding up search ([#3075](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3075))
- **M3DB**: Improve speed of bootstrap by using StreamingReadMetadata API for reads from disk ([#2938](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/2938))
- **M3DB**: Improve speed of bootstrap by using an asynchronously evaluated series resolver API that can be written to while bootstrapping reliably ([#3316](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3316))
- **M3DB**: Add limits for total series being read at any one time globally ([#3141](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3141))
- **M3DB**: Restrict the time a query can hold an index worker to help allow small queries to continue to execute while larger ones are paused and resumed ([#3269](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3269))
- **M3DB**: Use adaptive WriteBatch allocations to dynamically match workload throughput and batch sizes ([#3429](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3429))
- **M3Coordinator**: Improve rule matching speed by improving per element rule matching and disabling cache which puts locks in the hot path ([#3080](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3080), [#3083](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3083))
- **M3Query**: Improve speed of M3TSZ decoding by using 64 bit operations ([#2827](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/2827))
- **M3Query**: Improve speed of M3TSZ decoding by using int64 type xtime.UnixNano instead of time.Time ([#3515](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3515))
- **M3Query**: Improve speed of quorum reads by improving multi-replica iterator ([#3512](https://github.com/m3db/m3/pull/3512))

# CRI-O v1.21.3

The release notes have been generated for the commit range
[v1.21.2...ff0b7fe](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/compare/v1.21.2...ff0b7feb8e12509076b4b0e338b6334ce466b293) on Thu, 09 Sep 2021 23:27:08 UTC.

## Changelog since v1.21.2

### Changes by Kind

#### Bug or Regression
 - Fix a bug where a container exec process received a little less time than the timeout provided ([#5093](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/pull/5093), [@haircommander](https://github.com/haircommander))
 - Fix a performance regression with exec probes ([#5162](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/pull/5162), [@haircommander](https://github.com/haircommander))
 - Fix potential panic when reopening a container's log ([#5213](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/pull/5213), [@haircommander](https://github.com/haircommander))

#### Uncategorized
 - Fix an RSS regression with exec sync requests ([#5262](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/pull/5262), [@haircommander](https://github.com/haircommander))
 - Fix an issue where a container started with a terminal fails on exec sync calls ([#5121](https://github.com/cri-o/cri-o/pull/5121), [@openshift-cherrypick-robot](https://github.com/openshift-cherrypick-robot))

## Dependencies

### Added
_Nothing has changed._

### Changed
_Nothing has changed._

### Removed
- github.com/rjeczalik/notify: [v0.9.2](https://github.com/rjeczalik/notify/tree/v0.9.2)

data.name: v0.5.2
data.body:
## 0.5.2 (September 09, 2021)

FEATURES:

* cli: Add a new command for inspecting project information, `waypoint project inspect`. [[GH-2055](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2055)]

IMPROVEMENTS:

* cli/status: Include a way to refresh project application statuses for deployments and releases with a '-refresh' flag before showing the status view [[GH-2081](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2081)]
* cli: Add functionality to list releases with `waypoint release list` command [[GH-2082](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2082)]
* core: App status polling will always queue status reports refresh jobs for latest deployment and release if present [[GH-2039](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2039)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Allow configuration of ALB subnets independently of service subnets [[GH-2205](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2205)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Allow public ip assignment for tasks to be disabled [[GH-2205](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2205)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Deployments delete their resources on failure. [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Error messages contain additional context [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Improve security of ECS tasks by restricting ingress to the ALB [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: More complete list of resources displayed in `waypoint deploy` logs [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Support for status reports, enabling `waypoint status` for ECS deployments [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/aws: Add ability to pass IAM policy ARNs for attaching to task role [[GH-1935](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/1935)]

BUG FIXES:

* internal/config: Fix parsing of complex HCL types in `-var-file` [[GH-2217](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2217)]
* plugin/aws-ecs: Fix panic when specifying a sidecar without a health check [[GH-2098](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2098)]
* plugin/nomad: Only use non-empty job.StatusDescription for HealthMessage [[GH-2093](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2093)]
* server/singleprocess: Stop returning error when polling an app with no deployment or release [[GH-2204](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2204)]
* ui: Fix leaky project repository settings being reused when creating a new project [[GH-2250](https://github.com/hashicorp/waypoint/issues/2250)]

data.name: Flux 1.24.1
data.body:
### [Flux v1 is in maintenance mode](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux/issues/3320)

All users are encouraged to migrate to Flux v2 or begin planning their migration, and to continue filing issues if migrations are blocked.

## 1.24.1 (2021-09-09)

This release fixes an issue when Docker Hub rate limit is not properly handled by Flux daemon as rate limiting. Docker Hub sends its rate limit warnings as an error that does not include the expected "429" Too Many Requests status code.

This release also includes a base image upgrade to Alpine 3.14.2 that mitigates several CVE scan warnings in the base image related to openssl and libgcrypt.

(A first attempt to publish this release on 2021-09-08 failed due to issues with `github-release`, so it was re-tagged on 2021-09-09 with changes to the CI job that resolved the issue.)

### Fixes

- Adding Docker Hub rate limit condition message [fluxcd/flux#3543][]

### Maintenance and documentation

- Add CodeQL Security Scanning [fluxcd/flux#3446][]
- Upgrade alpine:3.14.1 to alpine:3.14.2 [fluxcd/flux#3545][]

### Thanks

Thanks to @fdpeiter and @kingdonb for their contributions to this release.

[fluxcd/flux#3543]: https://github.com/fluxcd/flux/pull/3543
[fluxcd/flux#3446]: https://github.com/fluxcd/flux/pull/3446
[fluxcd/flux#3545]: https://github.com/fluxcd/flux/pull/3545

data.name: 🎉 CNI v1.0.1 🎉
data.body:
Hot off the presses, it's CNI v1.0!

CNI v1.0 doesn't change much about how CNI works, but it declares API stability.

This release includes
- a rewritten spec (for clarity)
- libcni improvements
- way more tests.

You can see the full spec changelog here: https://github.com/containernetworking/cni/blob/v1.0.1/Documentation/spec-upgrades.md

data.name: Longhorn v1.2.0 release
data.body:
## Release Note

**v1.2.0 released!** 🎆

This release introduces many enhancements and bug fixes as described below including stability, performance, availability, troubleshooting, and so on. Please try it and feedback. Thanks for all the contributions!

- [Support Kubernetes v1.22 and CSI components version update](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2757)
  - Updates the minimum supported version of Kubernetes to v1.18, can support Kubernetes v1.22 by migrating some deprecated resources to active resource versions and bump the version of CSI components.
- [Upload backing image](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2404)
  - Besides downloading backing images from remote in v1.1.1, users can upload backing images from local.
- [Create backing image from volume](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2403)
  - Besides downloading backing images from remote in v1.1.1, users can create backing images from existing volumes.
- [Enhance Longhorn data plane on low performance enviroment](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2206)
  - Enhance Longhorn data plane on low performance environment to better support in differnt resource factors (spinning disk, low network bandwidth, low CPU, network latency, etc).
- [Volume encryption](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1859) & [Backup encryption](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/902) [[doc](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/advanced-resources/volume-encryption/)]
  - Longhorn supports encrypted volumes by utilizing the linux kernel modules and uses the Kubernetes secret mechanism for key storage. An encrypted volume results in your data being encrypted while in transit as well as at rest, this also means that any backups taken from that volume are also encrypted.
- [Volume cloning](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1815) [[doc](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/snapshots-and-backups/csi-volume-clone/)]
  - Supports CSI volume cloning.
- [Support automatic replica rebalancing](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/587) [[doc](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/high-availability/auto-balance-replicas/)]
  - Supports automatically replica rebalancing when node status changes (on/off) based on node/zone soft anti-affinity.
- [Asynchronous backup operations](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1761)
  - Supports asynchronous backup operations by introducing backup target, backup volume and backup custom resource and controllers to improve the performance issues of backup operations in previous versions.
- [Recurring job & group](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/467) [[doc](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/snapshots-and-backups/scheduling-backups-and-snapshots/)]
  - Supports the concept of recurring job and group by introducing recuring job custom resource and controller. Users can create/resue recurring jobs and organize their jobs in groups to apply to volumes.

## Installation
> **Known issue:** 
> **After installing/upgrading to Longhorn v1.2.0, any storage class using the longhorn driver without `fsType` parameter specified probably will encounter  `fsGroup` ineffective issue when creating a new fs volume. This is due to the default fs setting being removed from the updated CSI external-provisioner. The solution has been provided (ref: https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2964#issuecomment-910969543) and this issue will be resolved in the following patch release (1.2.1) by the end of September.** 

Longhorn supports 3 installation ways including Rancher catalog, Kubectl, and Helm. Follow the installation instructions [here](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/deploy/install/).

## Upgrade
> **1. Please ensure your Kubernetes cluster is at least v1.18 before upgrading to Longhorn v1.2.0, because the supported Kubernetes version has been updated (>= v1.18) in v1.2.0.**
> **2. After the upgrade, the recurring job settings of volumes will be migrated to new recurring job resources and the `RecurringJobs` field in the volume spec will be deprecated. [[doc](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/deploy/upgrade/#4-automatically-migrate-recurring-jobs)]**

Follow the upgrade instructions [here](https://longhorn.io/docs/1.2.0/deploy/upgrade/).

## Highlights
  
  - [FEATURE] Default recurring backup policy ([467](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/467)) - @kaxing @c3y1huang
  - [FEATURE] Support automatic rebalance the replicas based on soft anti-affinity ([587](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/587)) - @kaxing @c3y1huang
  - [FEATURE] Support backup encryption ([902](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/902)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  - [REFACTORING] Longhorn Backup refactoring ([1761](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1761)) - @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [FEATURE] Support CSI volume cloning ([1815](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1815)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [FEATURE] Volume Encryption ([1859](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1859)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  - [FEATURE] Speed up rebuilding by getting checksum simultaneously ([1948](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1948)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Volume Attachment Recovery Policy feature conflicts with Pod Deletion Policy ([2060](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2060)) - @joshimoo @smallteeths
  - [FEATURE] Enhance Longhorn data plane on low performance environment (spinning disk, 1GBps network, low CPU etc) ([2206](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2206)) - @keithalucas @khushboo-rancher
  - [FEATURE] Create backing image from volume ([2403](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2403)) - @shuo-wu
  - [FEATURE] Backing image upload ([2404](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2404)) - @kaxing @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Failed rebuilding a large replica of 3TB ([2507](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2507)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Recurring jobs never run again when the volume is attached after being detached for a long time ([2513](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2513)) - @kaxing @PhanLe1010
  - [BUG] Volumes are not properly mounted/unmounted when kubelet restarts ([2629](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2629)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [FEATURE] Bump Kubernetes, API version group, CSI component's dependency version ([2757](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2757)) - @meldafrawi @PhanLe1010
  
## Enhancements
  
  - [FEATURE] Change default log level for csi sidecars, to reduce leader election log spam ([1202](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1202)) - @joshimoo
  - [FEATURE] automatic sucessful backups should only retain the last snapshot ([2231](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2231)) - @cclhsu @kaxing @PhanLe1010
  - [BUG] Application couldn't mount the volume after expanded the volume ([2422](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2422)) - @cclhsu @khushboo-rancher
  - [FEATURE] Backing image enhancement ([2530](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2530)) - @kaxing @shuo-wu
  - [FEATURE] Support Read only volumes (PVC/PV) and mounts ([2575](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2575)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  - [ENHANCEMENT] Add labels for created cron jobs / backup pods for recurring jobs ([2701](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2701)) - @kaxing @PhanLe1010
  - [FEATURE] Enable pprof endpoints in longhorn manager for troubleshooting ([2715](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2715)) - @kaxing @joshimoo
  - [FEATURE]  WebSocket to support updating BackupVolume and Backup changes ([2740](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2740)) - @kaxing @smallteeths @jenting
  - [FEATURE]  ui show exact time, not only "xx days ago" ([2808](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2808)) - @kaxing @smallteeths
  - [FEATURE] Support XFS for RWX volumes ([2814](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2814)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  - [FEATURE] UI support encrypted volumes ([2841](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2841)) - @meldafrawi @smallteeths
  - [FEATURE] Support encrypted RWX volumes ([2867](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2867)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  
## Performance
  
  - [BUG] Daemon set takes more time to come up with RWX PVC ([2102](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2102)) - @c3y1huang
  - [BUG] full data over WS at per 30/seconds interval seems useless ([2591](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2591)) - @c3y1huang @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] List order caused full data transfer when no resource updated. ([2646](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2646)) - @c3y1huang @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] List order caused full backup image data transfer when no resource updated. ([2672](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2672)) - @kaxing @c3y1huang
  - [BUG] Reduce Node Status updates by truncating disk StorageAvailable ([2680](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2680)) - @kaxing @joshimoo
  
## Bugs
  
  - [BUG] Investigate engine integration test failure - restore_with_frontend: can only restore backup from replica in mode RW, got ERR ([1628](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/1628)) - @keithalucas
  - [BUG] Scheduled backups didn't complete and leave tons of snapshots behind ([2029](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2029)) - @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Backup fails to complete due to timeout causing duplicate backups ([2278](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2278)) - @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] /engineUpgrade API error handling ([2289](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2289)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Priority class not getting set for recurring jobs ([2444](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2444)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] DR restored data is faulty in sles15-sp2 ([2503](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2503)) - @c3y1huang @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] The bulk delete for backing image button doesn't work if there are few images don't satisfy deletion condition. ([2506](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2506)) - @smallteeths
  - [BUG] Backing image can't be delete if key more than 63 characters ([2522](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2522)) - @shuo-wu @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] After network disconnection replicas cannot be reattached  ([2561](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2561)) - @meldafrawi @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Name column in event table on the volume detail page should be bigger. ([2567](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2567)) - @smallteeths @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Detach button on volume detail page doesn't work for a volume attach to a pod. ([2587](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2587)) - @smallteeths @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] UI mutiple selections should be released after performing action ([2595](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2595)) - @smallteeths @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Unable to provide own tls certificate for ingress using helm chart ([2615](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2615)) - @kaxing @jenting
  - [BUG] Failure to create a volume on a retry since v1.1.1 ([2624](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2624)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Fix missed deepcopy cases for Volume.Status.KubernetesStatus and EngineStatus.Snapshots.Snapshot ([2631](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2631)) - @joshimoo
  - [BUG] Normalize pod order for v.status.KubernetesStatus updates ([2632](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2632)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Fix AnnotateAWSIAMRoleArn modifying lister returned pod instances directly ([2633](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2633)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Volume stuck in Detaching when detached during rebuild / snapshot coalescing (EXT4) ([2640](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2640)) - @joshimoo
  - [BUG] UI multiple selections should be released after performing action on the backup page ([2652](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2652)) - @kaxing @smallteeths
  - [BUG] kubectl drain node gets stuck forever ([2673](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2673)) - @cclhsu @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Improve usage of Readonly listers where we only read ([2681](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2681)) - @joshimoo
  - [BUG] NPE when listing backups of a backup volume ([2683](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2683)) - @kaxing @jenting
  - [BUG] volume creation with an invalid FromBackup should fail ([2686](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2686)) - @kaxing @joshimoo
  - [BUG] 'Bulk Update Recurring Snapshot and Backup' dialog says 'No Data' ([2691](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2691)) - @kaxing @smallteeths
  - [BUG] Liveness/Readiness Probe timeoutSeconds at Kubernetes v1.20+ ([2699](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2699)) - @kaxing @jenting
  - [BUG] Backup / restore with AWS IAM Role fails with NoCredentialProviders ([2718](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2718)) - @jenting
  - [BUG] High CPU utilization for Longhorn manager sometimes due to exhaustion of all the available sockets because of socket leaking log stream ([2778](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2778)) - @meldafrawi @PhanLe1010
  - [BUG] longhorn-engine image no longer contains longhorn-instance manager ([2796](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2796)) - @innobead @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Longhorn-csi-plugin pods restart because the Longhorn client 10 secs timeout ([2816](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2816)) - @jenting
  - [BUG] High CPU utilization for Longhorn manager and replica instance manager sometimes due to overwhelming of number of backupstatus in engine ([2818](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2818)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] fix instance manager grpc connection leak (VersionGet, ProcessLog, ProcessWatch) ([2824](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2824)) - @joshimoo
  - [BUG] Datastore::GetEngine returns raw cached object which is then modified ([2827](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2827)) - @joshimoo @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Node deletion leads volume to get stuck in attaching state ([2848](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2848)) - @joshimoo @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Replica rebuilding fails and eventually pass after few attempts ([2849](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2849)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Actual size is showing unknown on volume detail page ([2861](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2861)) - @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] The forwarder/proxy doesn't work for HTTPs requests ([2869](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2869)) - @shuo-wu @khushboo-rancher

  - [BUG] Longhorn v1.2.0-preview1 not compatible with old engine image v1.1.2 on backup creation ([2897](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2897)) - @kaxing @jenting
  - [BUG] Longhorn CSI does not validate existing backing images with the fields in StorageClass during volume creation ([2899](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2899)) - @kaxing @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Cannot create a backing image via a YAML file ([2900](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2900)) - @meldafrawi @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] DR volume failed to be mounted after activation when the original volume is encrypted.   ([2905](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2905)) - @joshimoo @meldafrawi
  - [BUG] Failed to mount restored backup when original volume is encrypted, and PV filesystem is xfs ([2906](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2906)) - @joshimoo @smallteeths
  - [BUG] Uninstall job failed if there are many backups ([2910](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2910)) - @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Invalid backup is getting listed on the backup page ([2912](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2912)) - @smallteeths @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Backup should immediately stop showing the backups on setting backup target blank ([2913](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2913)) - @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] On switching the backup target, the backup keep showing from the older target ([2915](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2915)) - @shuo-wu @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Undergoing backup information will be shown as blank in the table ([2916](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2916)) - @kaxing @smallteeths
  - [BUG] Instance managers keep terminating and getting created while uninstallation is in progress ([2919](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2919)) - @meldafrawi @shuo-wu @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] DR volume does not continue to restore after node reboot ([2920](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2920)) - @c3y1huang @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Power off node during backup volume restore does not continue restore ([2929](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2929)) - @kaxing @c3y1huang @shuo-wu @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Backing Image - Upload From Local File with large image file shows Payload Size Too Large error ([2937](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2937)) - @smallteeths @shuo-wu
  - [BUG] Uninstallation job stuck ([2945](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2945)) - @PhanLe1010 @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Backup restore failed due to the size of the BackupVolume is empty ([2950](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2950)) - @shuo-wu
  
## Misc
  
  - [REFACTORING] controller: Move LastBackup/LastBackupAt update into the volume controller ([844](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/844)) - @jenting
  - [BUG] Docs search tool only partially working ([2155](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2155)) - @jenting @khushboo-rancher
  - [BUG] Newly installed 1.1.0 on Kubernetes and UI editing broken ([2156](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2156)) - @jenting
  - [DOC] Reference Architecture and Sizing Guidelines ([2598](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2598)) - @kaxing @PhanLe1010
  - [DOC] Add document about how to deal with filesystem corruption ([2779](https://github.com/longhorn/longhorn/issues/2779)) - @c3y1huang
  
## Contributors

- @PhanLe1010
- @c3y1huang
- @cclhsu
- @innobead
- @jenting
- @joshimoo
- @kaxing
- @keithalucas

- @meldafrawi
